pages.text: Diplodocus was a genus of Diplodocid sauropod dinosaur which lived in what is now mid-western North America from about 154 to 152 million years ago, During the Kimmeridgian Age of the Morrison Formation. Being one of the best known sauropods, we know a lot about these dinosaurs with their long necks and tails. It is thought they would have been lighter than their fellow sauropods of similar sizes with Diplodocus being at 12-14.8 tons while Apatosaurus weighs 16.4-22.4 tons.

With Diplodocus's generally lighter frame it is thought that they could move reletively quick for their large size with speed estimates being at 12-22 miles per hour. but with the stress it would cause to their limbs they may prefer to amble most of the time.
